intro: Dicliptera cardiocarpa, commonly known as the heart-leaved dicliptera, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its opposite, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by small, round berries. Dicliptera cardiocarpa is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
